description: Apocrine Hydrocystoma is a benign cystic lesion that typically occurs on the skin, often in areas with high concentrations of apocrine sweat glands. It is usually small in size and may appear as a clear or bluish bump on the skin.
symptoms: Small, fluid-filled bump on the skin
May be painless or cause mild discomfort
treatments: Surgical removal if desired for cosmetic reasons or if causing symptoms
